statements: SELECT * FROM climate_data;
SELECT location, temperature FROM climate_data WHERE precipitation > 0.5 ORDER BY temperature DESC;
SELECT id, location, sea_level FROM climate_data WHERE temperature < 20;
SELECT * FROM climate_data ORDER BY sea_level ASC, temperature DESC;
SELECT id, location FROM climate_data WHERE precipitation < 1 AND sea_level > 0 ORDER BY location ASC;
SELECT * FROM climate_data WHERE temperature > 25 ORDER BY location ASC
SELECT location, temperature, precipitation FROM climate_data WHERE sea_level > 1000 ORDER BY temperature DESC
SELECT id, location, precipitation FROM climate_data WHERE precipitation < 5 AND sea_level < 500 ORDER BY id DESC
SELECT * FROM climate_data WHERE precipitation BETWEEN 2 AND 5 ORDER BY location, temperature
SELECT id, location, temperature, sea_level FROM climate_data WHERE sea_level > 500 ORDER BY sea_level
SELECT * FROM temperature WHERE location = 'New York'
SELECT date, location FROM temperature ORDER BY date DESC
SELECT AVG(temperature) FROM temperature WHERE location = 'Los Angeles'
SELECT * FROM precipitation WHERE location = 'Chicago' AND precipitation > 1.5
SELECT location, date, precipitation FROM precipitation ORDER BY precipitation DESC
SELECT * FROM temperature WHERE temperature > 25 ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT location, AVG(temperature) AS avg_temp FROM temperature GROUP BY location ORDER BY avg_temp DESC
SELECT MAX(temperature) AS max_temp, MIN(temperature) AS min_temp FROM temperature WHERE location='New York'
SELECT date, location, temperature FROM temperature WHERE date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-02-01' ORDER BY temperature ASC
SELECT location, COUNT(*) AS num_records FROM temperature GROUP BY location HAVING COUNT(*) > 50 ORDER BY num_records DESC
SELECT * FROM temperature WHERE location='New York' ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT AVG(value) FROM precipitation WHERE location='London';
SELECT location, MAX(value) FROM sea_levels GROUP BY location;
SELECT date, value FROM temperature WHERE location='Paris' ORDER BY value ASC;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM precipitation WHERE location='Tokyo';
SELECT location, value FROM temperature WHERE date = '2022-01-01' ORDER BY location ASC;
SELECT * FROM precipitation WHERE location = 'New York' ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT AVG(value) AS average_temperature, location FROM temperature GROUP BY location;
SELECT location, SUM(value) AS total_precipitation FROM precipitation GROUP BY location HAVING total_precipitation > 100;
SELECT * FROM sea_levels WHERE location = 'London' AND value > 5 ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT * FROM temperature ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT location, temp_celsius FROM temperature WHERE temp_celsius > 30;
SELECT AVG(temp_celsius) AS avg_temp FROM temperature;
SELECT * FROM precipitation WHERE location = 'New York';
SELECT date, sea_level_m FROM sea_levels ORDER BY sea_level_m ASC;
SELECT * FROM temperature ORDER BY date DESC, temp_celsius ASC
SELECT location, temperature FROM analysis WHERE temperature > 30 ORDER BY location ASC
SELECT location, precipitation_mm FROM precipitation WHERE location='New York' AND precipitation_mm > 50 ORDER BY precipitation_mm DESC
SELECT * FROM sea_levels WHERE sea_level_m < 0 ORDER BY location ASC, date DESC
SELECT date, analysis_id, temperature, precipitation, sea_level FROM analysis ORDER BY analysis_id ASC, date DESC
SELECT * FROM temperature;
SELECT temperature_id, temperature_value, location, date FROM precipitation ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT temperature_value, location FROM sea_levels WHERE location = 'New York' ORDER BY temperature_value DESC;
SELECT date, location, precipitation_value FROM analysis_data WHERE precipitation_value > 50;
SELECT model_id, temperature, sea_level FROM modeling_data WHERE sea_level > 3 ORDER BY model_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM temperature WHERE location='New York' ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT location, temperature_value FROM precipitation WHERE temperature_value > 50 ORDER BY location ASC, date DESC;
SELECT location, temperature, precipitation FROM analysis_data WHERE temperature >= 25 AND precipitation < 10 AND sea_level > 5 ORDER BY location ASC, date ASC;
SELECT DISTINCT location FROM modeling_data WHERE sea_level > 3 AND precipitation < 20 ORDER BY location DESC;
SELECT date, temperature, sea_level FROM sea_levels WHERE sea_level > 4 OR temperature < 15 ORDER BY date ASC;
